title.rendered: Dallas Developer Group Road to CTA: July 2020

content.rendered:
Road To CTA
July 22Dallas Developer Group


The Group & Event


The Event

Join us Wednesday, July 22 as we gather (virtually) to discuss News in the Salesforce world with our peers. We are thrilled to have MVP Meighan Brodkey tell us about the long road to that most coveted certification “CTA”. Meighan will share with us How and Why she has undertaken that journey as well as advising others who are interested in pursuing the same.

Event Posting


About Dallas DUG Group

Welcome to the Dallas Salesforce Developers Group. We hold multiple events each month, including dinner meetings, Saturday certification classes, summer camps for students and charity Salesforce hackathons. We subscribe to an “open table” philosophy – all are welcome (you don’t have to be a developer to enjoy our discussions).  Salesforce orgs ranging from SMB to very large multi-national instances are represented in our user group. Please join us at our next meeting!  Reminder, all group leadership discussions take place on our group’s chatter page. FF

Chatter Page

The Dallas Salesforce Developers as we talk all-things-Salesforce.  Our monthly meeting is held on the forth Wednesday of each month on the UTD campus (except during Corona virus lockdown, when they are held virtually). Our meetings are announced here and on our facebook page (http://bit.ly/2UWHfPt) . Salesforce orgs ranging from SMB to very large multi-national instances are represented in our user group. Please join us at our next meeting!

Dallas Dev User Group Events

You’ll realize there’s a lot you don’t know, it’s ok to realize that you know even less than you though
t

Group Leaders


Moyez Thanawalla

Thanawalla Digital  President

@MoyezThanawalla


Paul McCollum

Sense Corp.Leader

@uxaholic


Amey Kulkarni

SlalomLeader

@a_kulk


Nishchitha Nagaraj

Leader

@Nishchitha17

Don’t be Afraid to Fail along the way, you will…You only fail if you don’t learn from your mistakes and grow.

Resources


Event Deck


View Deck


Architect Pyramid

Application Architect – the side of the pyramid based around native features and functionality, as well as modeling the role hierarchy, data model, and appropriate sharing mechanisms.System Architect –  focused on off-platform systems, integration, securing access between systems, governance and deployment – including but not limited to DevOps, CI/CD, Source Control, automated testing, performance – and ongoing modification requirements. 

More on Certification



Architect Trailblazer Community

Official Salesforce Run: Building an eco-system of domain and technical architect experts.Join this group if you are wanting to go down the path of becoming any type of Architect! Updates on the Architect Journey as well as other important information. 

View Group



RoadToCTA SalesforceSaturday

A place to hang, meet other architects, study, share tips, tricks, lessons learned, encourage each other, study with each other and/or have dedicated time, learn from each other, and make some new friends. This group is 100% virtual during covid and beyond for our Saturday events.  All are welcome – no matter their geography, or how far they are on their journey.

Chatter Group


System Arch

Scenario Doc for System arch

Chatter File


Application Arch

Scenario Doc for Application arch

Chatter File



Review Board Checklist

Checklist before you say you are ready

Chatter File

excerpt.rendered: July 22 as we gathered (virtually) to discuss News in the Salesforce world with our peers.Thrilled to join Dallas Developer User Group to share will share with us the How and Why I has undertaken the journey to CTA as well as advising others who are interested in pursuing. Learn the real lessons and hard truths I learned the hard way for you, and with others to help you get ahead.
